    <dl>
           <dt>ma 1</dt>
           <dd><em>ma</em> the labial nasal. -1</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; mak&#x0101;ra </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;k&#x0101;ra</em> m. the letter or sound <em>ma</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;khBr">&#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;khBr.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a>Pari&#x015b; &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-pa&#x00f1;caka</em> n. = <em>pa&#x00f1;ca-mak&#x0101;ra</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#W">W.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x25cb;r&#x00e2;di-sahasran&#x0101;man</em> n. N. of ch. of the Rudra-y&#x0101;mala (containing 1000 names of R&#x0101;ma beginning with <em>m</em>)</dd>

           <dt>ma 2</dt>
           <dd><em>ma</em> m. (in prosody) a molossus. -2</dd>

           <dt>ma 3</dt>

           <dd>&#x2022; abl. <em>m&#x00e1;t</em> or <em>m&#x00e1;d</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; gen. <em>m&#x00e1;ma</em> or me (for the enclitic forms, <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#cf">cf.</a> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 8-1, 22 &amp;c.) [Cf. s. <em>m&#x00e1;d</em> ; Zd. <em>ma</em> ; Gk. ?, ?, Lat. <em>me</em>, <em>mihi</em> &amp;c.] [771, 1]</dd>

           <dt>makara </dt>
           <dd><em>m&#x00e1;kara</em> m. a kind of sea-monster (sometimes confounded with the crocodile, shark, dolphin &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; regarded as the emblem of K&#x0101;ma-deva [cf. <em>mokara-ketana</em> &amp;c. below] or as a symbol of the 9th Arhat of the present Avasarpi&#x1e47;&#x012b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; represented as an ornament on gates or on head-dresses) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VS">VS.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. species of insect or other small animal <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Su&#x015b;r">Su&#x015b;r.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of the 10th sign of the zodiac (Capricornus) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#S&#x016b;ryas">S&#x016b;ryas.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Var">Var.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the 10th arc of 30 degrees in any circle <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an army of troops in the form of a M&#x00e1;kara <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> vii, 187 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an ear-ring shaped like a M&#x00e1;kara <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> (cf. <em>makara-ku&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;ala</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the hands folded in the form of a M&#x00e1;kara <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Cat">Cat.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; one of the 9 treasures of Kubera <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. magical spell recited over weapons <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a mountain <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; pf. <em>mamajja</em> [2. sg. <em>mamajjitha</em>, or <em>mama&#x1e45;ktha</em>] <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; <em>m&#x00e1;jjya</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a>), to sink (into), (acc. or loc.), go down, go to hell, perish, become ruined <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to sink (in water), dive, plunge or throw one's self into (loc.), bathe, be submerged or drowned <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x1e62;a&#x1e0d;vBr">&#x1e62;a&#x1e0d;vBr.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r">K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c.: Caus. <em>majj&#x00e1;yati</em> (aor. <em>amamajjat</em> Gr.), to cause to sink, submerge, drown, overwhelm, destroy <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;Br">&#x015a;Br.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to inundate <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to strike or plant into (loc.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a>: Desid. <em>mima&#x1e45;k&#x1e63;ati</em> or <em>mimajji&#x1e63;ati</em> Gr. (cf. <em>mima&#x1e45;k&#x1e63;&#x0101;</em>): Intens. <em>m&#x0101;majjyate</em>, <em>m&#x0101;ma&#x1e45;kti</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> [Cf. Lat. <em>mergere</em>, and under <em>majjan</em>.]</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; magna </dt>
           <dd><em>magna</em> mfn. sunk, plunged, immersed in (loc. or comp.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r">K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; set (as the moon) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sunk into misfortune <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (ifc.) slipped into, lurking in <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Ragh">Ragh.</a> </dd>

(according to <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;Br">&#x015a;Br.</a> &amp;c. one of the 5 elements or essential ingredients of the body <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p773-3"></a>[Page 773, Column 3]</font>

           <dt>math 1</dt>
           <dd><em>math</em> or <em>manth</em> (q.v.), cl. 1. 9. P. (cf. Dh&#x0101;tup. xx, 18, iii, 5 and xxxi, 40) <em>m&#x00e2;thati</em>, <em>m&#x00e1;nthati</em>, <em>mathn&#x0101;&#x0341;ti</em> (Ved. and ep. also &#x0100;. <em>m&#x00e1;thate</em>, <em>m&#x00e1;nthate</em> and <em>mathn&#x012b;te</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Impv. <em>mathnadhvam</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pf. <em>mam&#x0101;tha</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 3. pl. <em>mamathu&#x1e25;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Vop">Vop.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>methu&#x1e25;</em>, <em>methire</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>mamantha</em>, <em>&#x25cb;nthu&#x1e25;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>math&#x012b;t</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>amanthi&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;&#x0101;m</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>amathi&#x1e63;ata</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. <em>mathi&#x1e63;yati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> <em>manthi&#x1e63;yati</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>mathit&#x0101;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; inf. <em>mathitum</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x25cb;tos</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>m&#x00e1;nthitava&#x00ed;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MaitrS">MaitrS.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ind. p. <em>mathitv&#x0101;&#x0341;</em>, <em>-m&#x00e1;thya</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>manthitv&#x0101;</em>, PI&#x1e47;. i, 2, 33 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-manthya</em> and <em>-m&#x0101;tham</em> n. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c.). to stir or whirl round <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with <em>agnim</em>), to produce fire by rapidly whirling round or rotating a dry stick (<em>ara&#x1e47;i</em>) in another dry stick prepared to receive it <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with <em>ara&#x1e47;im</em>), to rotate the stick for producing fire <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pur">Pur.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with <em>&#x016b;rum</em>, <em>hastam</em> &amp;c.), to use friction upon any part of the body with the object of producing offspring from it <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hariv">Hariv.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to churn (milk into butter), produce by churning <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#TS">TS.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c. (also with two acc., e.g. <em>sudh&#x0101;&#x1e43;</em> <em>k&#x1e63;&#x012b;ra-nidhim mathn&#x0101;ti</em>, 'he churns nectar out of the ocean of milk' <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Siddh">Siddh.</a> on <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 1-4, 51) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to mix, mingle <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Su&#x015b;r">Su&#x015b;r.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to stir up, shake, agitate, trouble disturb, afflict, distress, hurt, destroy <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c.: Pass. <em>mathy&#x00e1;te</em> (ep. also <em>&#x25cb;ti</em>), to be stirred up or churned &amp;c. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c.: Caus. <em>manthayati</em> (cf. L&#x0101;&#x1e6d;y.), [mAthayati] (cf. MBh.), to cause to be stirred up or churned &amp;c.: Desid. <em>mimathi&#x1e63;ati</em>, <em>mimanthi&#x1e63;ati</em> Gr.: Intens. <em>m&#x0101;mathyate</em>, <em>m&#x0101;mantti</em> &amp;c. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> [Cf. Gk. ? ; Lat. <em>mentha</em>, <em>menta</em> ; Lit. <em>ment&#x00fa;re3</em> ; Germ. [777, 1] <em>min&#x015b;a</em>, <em>&#x1e43;in&#x015b;e</em> ; Angl. Sax. <em>minte</em> ; Eng. <em>mint</em>.]</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; mathana </dt>
           <dd><em>mathana</em> mf(<em>&#x012b;</em>, once <em>&#x0101;</em>)n. rubbing, stirring, shaking, harassing, destroying (with gen. or ifc.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. Premna Spinosa (the wood of which is used to produce fire by attrition) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. the act of rubbing, friction <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; stirring or whirling round, churning or producing by churning <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pur">Pur.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; hurting, annoying, injury, destruction <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Ratn&#x00e2;v">Ratn&#x00e2;v.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; mathan&#x0101;cala </dt>
           <dd><em>mathan&#x00e2;cala</em> m. the mountain (Mandara, q.v.) used as a churning-stick (by the gods and D&#x0101;navas in churning the ocean of milk) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> (cf. <em>mantha-&#x015b;aita</em>)</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#cf">cf.</a> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 3-2, 27), <em>ur&#x0101;-</em>, <em>vastra-</em> and <em>havir-m&#x00e1;thi</em> (<em>math&#x012b;n&#x0101;&#x0341;n</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> viii, 53, 8 prob. w&#x1e5b;. for <em>mat&#x012b;n&#x0101;&#x0341;m</em> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; n. buttermilk churned without water <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kau&#x015b;">Kau&#x015b;.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; mathin </dt>
           <dd><em>mathin</em> m. (strong stem, <em>m&#x00e1;nthan</em>, older <em>m&#x00e1;nth&#x0101;</em> ; middle <em>math&#x00ed;n</em> or <em>math&#x00ed;</em> <em>q.v.</em> ; sg. nom. <em>m&#x00e1;nth&#x0101;s</em> acc. <em>m&#x00e1;nth&#x0101;m</em> [for <em>mantk&#x0101;nam</em> <em>manth&#x0101;na</em> under &#x221a;<em>manth</em>] <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p777-2"></a>[Page 777, Column 2]</font>
 ; instr. <em>math&#x0101;&#x0341;</em> du. <em>math&#x00ed;bhy&#x0101;m</em> pl. <em>math&#x00ed;bhyas</em> &amp;c.            <dt>mad 2</dt>
           <dd><em>mad</em> (cf. &#x221a;<em>mand</em>), cl. 4.P. (cf. Dh&#x0101;tup. xxvi, 99) <em>m&#x0101;&#x0341;dyati</em> (ep. also <em>&#x25cb;te</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Ved. also I. P. &#x0100;. <em>m&#x0101;&#x0341;dyati</em> <em>&#x25cb;te</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 3. P. <em>mam&#x00e1;tti</em>, <em>&#x25cb;ttu</em>, <em>mam&#x00e1;dat</em>, <em>&#x00e1;mamadu&#x1e25;</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Ved. Impv. <em>m&#x00e1;tsi</em>, <em>&#x25cb;sva</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pf. <em>mam&#x0101;&#x0341;da</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>am&#x0101;di&#x1e63;u&#x1e25;</em>, <em>amatsu&#x1e25;</em>, <em>amatta</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Subj. <em>m&#x00e1;tsati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;sat</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. <em>madit&#x0101;</em>, <em>madi&#x1e63;yati</em> Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Ved. inf. <em>maditos</em>), to rejoice, be glad, exult, delight or revel in (instr., gen., loc., rarely acc.), be drunk (also fig.) with (instr.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to enjoy heavenly bliss (said of gods and deceased ancestors) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#TBr">TBr.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to boil bubble (as water) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#TS">TS.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;Br">&#x015a;Br.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hariv">Hariv.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to gladden, exhilarate, intoxicate, animate, inspire <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a>: Caus. [mAd&#x00e1;yati], <em>&#x25cb;te</em> (cf. Dh&#x0101;tup. xxxiii, 31, xix, 54 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>&#x00e1;m&#x012b;madat</em> or <em>amamadat</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Ved. inf. <em>maday&#x00e1;dhyai</em>), to gladden, delight, satisfy, exhilarate, intoxicate, inflame, inspire <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (&#x0100;.) to be glad, rejoice, be pleased or happy or at ease <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VS">VS.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kau&#x015b;">Kau&#x015b;.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (&#x0100;.) to enjoy heavenly bliss <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#TBr">TBr.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a>: Desid. <em>mimadi&#x1e63;ati</em> Gr.: Intens. <em>m&#x0101;madyate</em>, <em>m&#x0101;matti</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> [Perhaps orig. 'to be moist' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Gk">Gk.</a> ? ; Lat. <em>madere</em>.] [777, 3]</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; matta </dt>
           <dd><em>matt&#x00e1;</em> mfn. excited with joy, overjoyed, delighted, drunk, intoxicated (lit. and fig.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; excited by sexual passion or desire, in rut, ruttish (as an elephant) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; furious, mad, insane <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. a buffalo <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the Indian cuckoo <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a drunkard <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a ruttish or furious elephant <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a madman <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>

           <dt>madhu </dt>
           <dd><em>m&#x00e1;dhu</em> mf([U] or <em>vii</em>)n. (gen. n. Ved. <em>m&#x00e1;dhvas</em>, <em>m&#x00e1;dhos</em>, or <em>m&#x00e1;dhunas</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; instr. <em>m&#x00e1;dhv&#x0101;</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; dat. <em>m&#x00e1;dhune</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; loc. <em>m&#x00e1;dhau</em>) sweet, delicious, pleasant, charming, delightful <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#TS">TS.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; bitter or pungent <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. N. of the first month of the year (= Caitra, March-April) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;Br">&#x015a;Br.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the season of spring <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Var">Var.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;lid">K&#x0101;lid.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Bassia Latifolia <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Jonesia Asoka <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; liquorice <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of &#x015a;iva <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of two Asuras (the one killed by Vish&#x1e47;u, the other by &#x015a;atru-ghna) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hariv">Hariv.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pur">Pur.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of one of the 7 sages under Manu C&#x0101;kshusha <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#M&#x0101;rkP">M&#x0101;rkP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of the third Manu <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hariv">Hariv.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of various princes (of a son of V&#x1e5b;isha, of Deva-kshatra, of Bindu-mat, of Arjuna K&#x0101;rtavirya) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hariv">Hariv.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pur">Pur.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;a-n&#x0101;r&#x0101;ya&#x1e47;a, Kshitt&#x00ee;s of a teacher (= <em>madhva</em> or <em>ananda-t&#x012b;rtha</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Col">Col.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a mountain <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#M&#x0101;rkP">M&#x0101;rkP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (pl.) the race of Madhu (= the Y&#x0101;davas or M&#x0101;thuras) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hariv">Hariv.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>u</em>), f. a partic. plant (= <em>j&#x012b;v&#x0101;</em> or <em>j&#x012b;vant&#x012b;</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. anything sweet (esp. if liquid), mead &amp;c. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#TBr">TBr.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Soma (also <em>somyam madhu</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; honey (said to possess intoxicating qualities and to be of 8 kinds </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>madhuno leha</em> m. licker of honey a bee <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#W">W.</a>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; milk or anything produced from milk (as butter, ghee &amp;c.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VS">VS.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#G&#x1e5b;&#x015a;rS">G&#x1e5b;&#x015a;rS.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the juice or nectar of flowers, any sweet intoxicating drink, wine or spirituous liquor <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Var">Var.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#S&#x0101;h">S&#x0101;h.</a> <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p779-3"></a>[Page 779, Column 3]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sugar <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; water <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pyrites <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Bhpr">Bhpr.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a Br&#x0101;hma&#x1e47;a <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;Br">&#x015a;Br.</a> ; a kind of metre <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Col">Col.</a> [Cf.            <dt>madhya </dt>
           <dd><em>m&#x00e1;dhya</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;</em>)n. middle (used like <em>medius</em> e.g. <em>m&#x00e1;dhye</em> <em>samudr&#x00e9;</em>, 'in the midst of the sea') <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VPr&#x0101;t">VPr&#x0101;t.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Ka&#x1e6d;hUp">Ka&#x1e6d;hUp.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; middlemost, intermediate, central <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Var">Var.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Megh">Megh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; standing between two, impartial, neutral <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;m">K&#x0101;m.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; middle i.e. being of a middle kind or size or quality, middling, moderate (with <em>v&#x1e5b;tti</em> f. 'a middle course') <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L&#x0101;&#x1e6d;y">L&#x0101;&#x1e6d;y.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Su&#x015b;r">Su&#x015b;r.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in astron.) mean i.e. theoretical (opp. to <em>spa&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;a</em>, or <em>sphu&#x1e6d;a</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#S&#x016b;ryas">S&#x016b;ryas.</a> (<em>-tva</em> n.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; lowest, worst <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. n. (ifc. f. <em>&#x0101;</em>) the middle of the body, (esp.) a woman's waist <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;Br">&#x015a;Br.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in alg.) the middle term or the mean of progression <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Col">Col.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. a young woman, a girl arrived at puberty <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#S&#x0101;h">S&#x0101;h.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the middle finger <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in music) a partic. tone <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Sa&#x1e43;g&#x012b;t">Sa&#x1e43;g&#x012b;t.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (also n.) a kind of metre <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Col">Col.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. (m., g. <em>ardharc&#x00e2;di</em>) the middle, midst, centre, inside, interior <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c. (<em>am</em> ind. into the midst of, into, among, with gen. or ifc. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>ena</em> ind. in or through the midst of, on the inside, through, between, with gen., acc. or ifc. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;Br">&#x015a;Br.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x0101;t</em> ind. from the midst of. out of. from among <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hariv">Hariv.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>e</em> ind., s.v.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the middle of the sky (with or scil. <em>nabhasas</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; space between (e.g. <em>bhruvos</em>, the eye brows) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; midday (with <em>ahna&#x1e25;</em>), M&#x0101;av </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the meridian <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#M&#x0101;lat&#x012b;m">M&#x0101;lat&#x012b;m.</a> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; cessation, pause, interval <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a country between Sindh and Hind&#x016b;stan proper <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Cat">Cat.</a> [Cf. Zd. <em>maidhya</em> </dd>

           <dt>man </dt>
           <dd><em>man</em> cI.8.4.&#x0100;. (<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Dh&#x0101;tup">Dh&#x0101;tup.</a> xxx, 9 ; xxv, 67) <em>manut&#x00e9;</em>, <em>m&#x00e1;nyate</em> (ep. also <em>&#x25cb;ti</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 3. pl. <em>manvat&#x00e9;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pf. <em>mene</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>mamn&#x0101;&#x0341;the</em>, <em>&#x25cb;n&#x0101;&#x0341;ts</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>&#x00e1;mata</em>, <em>&#x00e1;manmahi</em> Subj. <em>man&#x0101;mahe</em>, <em>mananta</em>, p. <em>man&#x0101;n&#x00e1;</em>, q.v. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>ma&#x1e43;si</em>, <em>ama&#x1e43;sta</em> Subj. <em>ma&#x1e43;sate</em> Prec. <em>ma&#x1e43;s&#x012b;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;a</em>, 1. pers. m. c. <em>mas&#x012b;ya</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>m&#x0101;&#x1e43;sta</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a>, <em>&#x25cb;st&#x0101;dm</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#T&#x0100;r">T&#x0100;r.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>mandhvam</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>amani&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;a</em> Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. <em>ma&#x1e43;syate</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a>, <em>&#x25cb;ti</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>manta</em>, <em>manit&#x0101;</em> Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>mani&#x1e63;yate</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; inf. <em>mantum</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c., <em>m&#x00e1;ntave</em>, <em>&#x25cb;tavai</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a>, <em>m&#x00e1;ntos</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ind. p. <em>matv&#x0101;&#x0341;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Up">Up.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>manitv&#x0101;</em> Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-matya</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-manya</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c.), to think, believe, imagine, suppose, conjecture <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c. (<em>manye</em>, I think, methinks, is in later language often inserted in a sentence without affecting the construction </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#g">g.</a> <em>c&#x00e2;di</em> and <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 4-1, 106) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to regard or consider any one or anything (acc.) as (acc. with or without <em>iva</em>, or adv., often in <em>-vat</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in later language also dat., to express contempt [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#cf">cf.</a> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 2-3, 17], e g. <em>r&#x0101;jya&#x1e43; t&#x1e5b;&#x1e47;aya</em> <em>manye</em>, 'I value empire at a straw', i.e. I make light of it, = <em>laghu</em> &#x221a;<em>man</em>, and opp. to <em>bahu</em>, or <em>s&#x0101;dhu</em> &#x221a;<em>man</em>, to think much or well of. praise, approve) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to think one's self or be thought to be, appear as, pass for (nom </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; also with <em>iva</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be of opinion, think fit or right <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to agree or be of the same opinion with (acc.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to set the heart or mind on, honour, esteem (with <em>nau</em>, disdain), hope or wish for (acc. or gen.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to think of (in prayer &amp;c., either 'to remember, meditate on', or 'mention, declare', or 'excogitate, invent') <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to perceive, observe, leam, know, understand, comprehend (acc., Ved. also gen.). <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to offer, present <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a>: Caus. (<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Dh&#x0101;tup">Dh&#x0101;tup.</a> xxxiv, 36) <em>m&#x0101;nayati</em> (ep. also <em>&#x25cb;te</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>am&#x012b;manat</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Pass. <em>m&#x0101;nyate</em>), to honour, esteem, value highly (also with <em>uru</em>, <em>bahu</em> and <em>s&#x0101;dhu</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (&#x0100;.) <em>stavibhe</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Dh&#x0101;tup">Dh&#x0101;tup.</a> xxxiii, 35 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>garvake</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Vop">Vop.</a>: Desid. (cf. Dh&#x0101;tup. xxiii, 3) <em>m&#x012b;m&#x0101;&#x1e43;sate</em> (rarely <em>&#x25cb;ti</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>am&#x012b;m&#x0101;&#x1e43;si&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;h&#x0101;s</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;Br">&#x015a;Br.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>m&#x012b;n&#x0101;&#x1e43;sy&#x00e1;te</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>mima&#x1e43;sate</em>, <em>mimani&#x1e63;ate</em> Gr.), to reflect upon, consider, examine, investigate <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to cali in question, doubt ('with regard to', loc.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a>: Desid. of Desid. <em>mim&#x0101;mi&#x1e63;ate</em> Gr.: Intens. <em>manmanyate</em>, <em>manmanti</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> [Cf. Zd. <em>man</em> ; Gk. ?, ?, [783, 1] Lat. <em>meminisse</em>, <em>monere</em> ; Slav. and Lith. <em>min&#x00e9;ti</em> ; Goth. <em>ga-munan</em> ; Germ, <em>meinen</em> ; Eng. <em>mean</em>.]</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; mata </dt>

           <dt>&#x226b; mati </dt>
           <dd><em>mat&#x00ed;</em> (in <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;Br">&#x015a;Br.</a> also <em>m&#x00e1;ti</em>), f. devotion, prayer, worship, hymn, sacred utterance <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VS">VS.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; thought, design, intention, resolution, determination, inclination, wish, desire (with loc., dat. or inf.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c. (<em>maty&#x0101;</em> ind. wittingly, knowingly, purposely </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>mati&#x1e43;</em> &#x221a;<em>k&#x1e5b;</em> or <em>dh&#x0101;</em> or <em>dh&#x1e5b;</em> or <em>&#x0101;-&#x221a;dh&#x0101;</em> or <em>sam&#x0101;-&#x221a;dh&#x0101;</em> or <em>&#x0101;-&#x221a;sth&#x0101;</em> or <em>sam-&#x0101;-&#x221a;sth&#x0101;</em>, with loc., dat., acc. with <em>prati</em>, or <em>artham</em> ifc., to set the heart on, make up one's mind, resolve, determine </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>matim</em> with Caus. of <em>ni-&#x221a;v&#x1e5b;t</em> and abl. of a verbal noun, to give up the idea of </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x0101;hita-mati</em> ifc. -having resolved upon </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>viniv&#x1e5b;tta-mati</em> with abl. = having desisted from) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; opinion, notion, idea, belief, conviction, view, creed <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;rS">&#x015a;rS.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c. (<em>maty&#x0101;</em> ind. at will </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ifc., 'under the idea of', e.g. <em>vy&#x0101;ghra-m&#x25cb;</em>, 'under the idea of its being a tiger') </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the mind, perception, understanding, intelligence, sense, judgment <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;Br">&#x015a;Br.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c. (in <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> also 'that which is sensible', intelligent, mindful, applied to Aditi, Indra and Agni) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; esteem, respect, regard <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kir">Kir.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; memory, remembrance <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; n. thinking, reflection, meditation, thought, intelligence, understanding (esp. intrinsic knowledge or science, as one of the faculties connected with the senses <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Nir">Nir.</a> viii, 6 = <em>manman</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hariv">Hariv.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;a&#x1e43;k">&#x015a;a&#x1e43;k.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Sarvad">Sarvad.</a> (<em>&#x25cb;n&#x0101;&#x0341;</em> ind. thoughtfully, deliberately <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; homage, reverence <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#S&#x0101;y">S&#x0101;y.</a> on <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> i, 165, 4</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; mananagrantha </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;grantha</em> m</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; mana&#x015b; </dt>
           <dd><em>mana&#x015b;</em> in comp. for <em>manas</em>. -1</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; mana&#x015b;cit </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;c&#x00ed;t</em> mfn. (&#x221a;1. <em>ci</em>) piled up or constructed with the mind (= <em>manas&#x0101; cita&#x1e25;</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;Br">&#x015a;Br.</a> -2</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; mana&#x015b;cit </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;cit</em> mfn. (&#x221a;2. <em>cit</em>) thinking or reflecting in the mind <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> ix, 11, 8 (others, 'knowing the heart')</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; manas </dt>
           <dd><em>m&#x00e1;nas</em> n. mind (in its widest sense as applied to all the mental powers), intellect, intelligence, understanding, perception, sense, conscience, will <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c. (in phil. the internal organ or <em>anta&#x1e25;-kara&#x1e47;a</em> of perception and cognition, the faculty or instrument through which thoughts enter or by which objects of sense affect the soul <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#IW">IW.</a> 53 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in this sense <em>manas</em> is always is always regarded as distinct from <em>&#x0101;tman</em> and <em>puru&#x1e63;a</em>, 'spirit or soul' and belonging only to the body, like which it is - except in the Ny&#x0101;ya - considered perishable </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; as to its position in the various systems for Ny&#x0101;ya and Vai&#x015b;eshika <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#IW">IW.</a> 63 ; 67 ; 76, for S&#x0101;&#x1e43;khya and Ved&#x00e2;nta <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> 84 ; 109 ; 117 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> it is sometimes joined with <em>h&#x1e5b;d</em> or <em>h&#x1e5b;daya</em>, the heart <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> vii, 6 with <em>cak&#x1e63;us</em>, the eye) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the spirit or spiritual principle, the breath or living soul which escapes from the body at death (called <em>asu</em> in animals </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#above">above.</a>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; thought, imagination, excogitation, invention, reflection, opinion, intention, inclination, affection, desire, mood, temper, spirit <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> (ifc. after a verbal noun or an inf. stem in <em>&#x25cb;tu</em> = having a mind or wishing to </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>dra&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;u-m&#x25cb;</em> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>mana&#x1e25;</em> &#x221a;<em>k&#x1e5b;</em>, to make up one's mind </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with gen., to feel inclination for <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p784-1"></a>[Page 784, Column 1]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>mana&#x1e25;</em> &#x221a;<em>k&#x1e5b;</em>, <em>pra-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em>, &#x221a;<em>dh&#x0101;</em>, vi-&#x221a;<em>dh&#x0101;</em>, &#x221a;<em>dh&#x1e5b;</em>, &#x221a;<em>bandh</em> and Caus. of <em>ni-&#x221a;vi&#x015b;</em> with loc., dat., acc. with <em>prati</em>, or inf., to direct the mind or thoughts towards, think of or upon </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>mana&#x1e25;</em> with <em>sam-&#x0101;-&#x221a;dh&#x0101;</em>, to recover the senses, collect one's self </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with &#x221a;<em>han</em>, <em>mano-hatya</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>m&#x00e1;nas&#x0101;</em> ind. in the mind </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in thought or imagination </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with all the heart, willingly </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with gen., by the leave of </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>iva</em> = <em>&#x25cb;s&#x00ea;va</em>, as with a thought, in a moment </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with &#x221a;<em>man</em>, to think in one's mind, be willing or inclined </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>sa&#x1e43;-&#x221a;gam</em>, to become unanimous, agree </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>manasi</em> with &#x221a;<em>k&#x1e5b;</em>, to bear or ponder in the mind, meditate on, remember </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>ni-&#x221a;dh&#x0101;</em>, to impress on the mind, consider </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with &#x221a;<em>v&#x1e5b;t</em>, to be passing in one's mind) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of the 26th Kalpa (s.v.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Cat">Cat.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of the lake M&#x0101;nasa <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>manaso doha&#x1e25;</em>, N. of a S&#x0101;man <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x0100;rshBr">&#x0100;rshBr.</a> [Cf. Gk. ? ; Lat. [784, 1] <em>miner-va</em>.]</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; man&#x0101;k </dt>
           <dd><em>man&#x0101;k</em> ind. (prob. fr. <em>man&#x0101;</em> + <em>a&#x00f1;c</em>, 'perceivably') a little, slightly, in a small degree (<em>d&#x0101;nam man&#x0101;gapi</em>, a gift however small </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>k&#x0101;lam man&#x0101;k</em>, a little time <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p784-2"></a>[Page 784, Column 2]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>na m&#x25cb;</em>, not at all </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>man&#x0101;g asmi na p&#x0101;tita&#x1e25;</em>, I was all but thrown down) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kath&#x0101;s">Kath&#x0101;s.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; shortly, immediately, at once <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Prasannar">Prasannar.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; only, merely <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Ratn&#x00e2;v">Ratn&#x00e2;v.</a></dd>

           <dd><em>man&#x012b;&#x1e63;ik&#x0101;</em> f. wisdom, intelligence (<em>sva-man&#x012b;&#x1e63;ikay&#x0101;</em>, 'according to one's own judgment') <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; expectation <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#B&#x0101;lar">B&#x0101;lar.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; man&#x012b;&#x1e63;i&#x1e47;&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>man&#x012b;&#x1e63;i&#x1e47;&#x0101;</em> (?), f. a kind of metre <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;rutab">&#x015a;rutab.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; man&#x012b;&#x1e63;ita </dt>
           <dd><em>man&#x012b;&#x1e63;ita</em> mfn. desired, wished <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c </dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; man&#x012b;&#x1e63;itavar&#x1e63;in </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;var&#x1e63;in</em> mfn. showering desired objects (like a rain) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R&#x0101;jat">R&#x0101;jat.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; man&#x012b;&#x1e63;in </dt>
           <dd><em>man&#x012b;&#x1e63;in</em> mfn. thoughtful, intelligent, wise, sage, prudent. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; devout, offering prayers or praises <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. a learned Br&#x0101;hman, teacher, Pa&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;it <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#W">W.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a king <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VP">VP.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; man&#x012b;&#x1e63;it&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>man&#x012b;&#x1e63;i-t&#x0101;</em> f. wisdom <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Ve&#x1e47;is">Ve&#x1e47;is.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; manu </dt>
           <dd><em>m&#x00e1;nu</em> mfn. thinking, wise, intelligent <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VS">VS.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;Br">&#x015a;Br.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. 'the thinking creature(?)', man, mankind <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VS">VS.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AitBr">AitBr.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#T&#x0100;r">T&#x0100;r.</a> (also as opp. to evil spirits <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> i, 130, 8 ; viii, 98, 6 &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the &#x1e5a;ibhus are called <em>manor n&#x00e1;p&#x0101;ta&#x1e25;</em>, the sons of man, iii, 60, 3) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the Man par excellence or the representative man and father of the human race (regarded in the <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> as the first to have instituted sacrifices and religious ceremonies, and associated with the &#x1e5a;ishis Ka&#x1e47;va and Atri </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in the <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AitBr">AitBr.</a> described as dividing his possessions among some of his sons to the exclusion of one called N&#x0101;bh&#x0101;-nedish&#x1e6d;ha, q.v </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; called S&#x0101;&#x1e43;vara&#x1e47;a as author of <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> ix, 101, 10-12 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; &#x0100;psava as author of <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> 106, 7-9 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Naigh">Naigh.</a> v, 6 he is numbered among the 31 divine beings of the upper sphere, and <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VS">VS.</a> xi, 66 as father of men even identified with Prajs-pati </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; but the name Manu is esp. applied to 14 successive mythical progenitors and sovereigns of the earth, described <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> i, 63 and in later wks. as creating and supporting this world through successive Antaras or long periods of time, <em>manv-antara</em> below </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the first is called Sv&#x0101;yambhuva as sprung from <em>svayam-bh&#x016b;</em>, the Self-existent, and described in <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> 12, 34 as a sort of secondary creator, who commenced his work by producing 10 Praj&#x0101;patis or Maharshis, of whom the first was <em>mar&#x012b;ci</em>, Light </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to this Manu is ascribed the celebrated 'code of Manu', <em>manu-sa&#x1e43;hit&#x0101;</em>, and two ancient S&#x016b;tra works on Kalpa and G&#x1e5b;ihya i.e. sacrificial and domestic rites </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he is also called Haira&#x1e47;yagarbha as son of Hira&#x1e47;ya-garbha, and Pr&#x0101;cetasa, as son of Pra-cetas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the next 5 Manus are called Sv&#x0101;rocisha, Auttami, T&#x0101;masa, Raivata, C&#x0101;kshusha, <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#cf">cf.</a> IW. 208, n. 1 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the 7th Manu, called <em>vaivasvata</em>, Sun-born, or from his piety, <em>satya-vrata</em>, is regarded as the progenitor of the present race of living beings, and said, like the Noah of the Old Testament, to have been preserved from a great flood by Vish&#x1e47;u or Brahm&#x0101; in the form of a fish: he is also variously described as one of the 12 &#x0100;dityas, as the author of <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> viii, 27-31, as the brother of Yama, who as a son of he Sun is also called Vaivasvata, as the founder and first king of Ayodhy&#x0101;, and as father of Il&#x0101; who married Budha, son of the Moon, the two great solar and lunar races being thus nearly related to each other, <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#IW">IW.</a> 344 ; 373 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the 8th Manu or first of the future Manus, accord. to <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VP">VP.</a> iii, 2, will be S&#x0101;var&#x1e47;i </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the 9th Daksha-s&#x0101;var&#x1e47;i </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the 12th Rudra-s&#x1e6d;s&#x0101;var&#x1e47;i </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the 13th Raucya or Deva-s&#x1e6d;s&#x0101;var&#x1e47;i </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the 14th Bhautya or Indra-s&#x1e6d;s&#x0101;var&#x1e47;i) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; thought (= <em>manas</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#TS">TS.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a sacred text, prayer, incantation, spell (= <em>mantra</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R&#x0101;matUp">R&#x0101;matUp.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pa&#x00f1;car">Pa&#x00f1;car.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Prat&#x0101;p">Prat&#x0101;p.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of an Agni <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a Rudra <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pur">Pur.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of K&#x1e5b;i&#x015b;&#x00e2;&#x015b;va <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of an astronomer <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Cat">Cat.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (pl.) the mental Powers <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of the number 'fourteen' (on account of the 14 Manus) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#S&#x016b;ryas">S&#x016b;ryas.</a> <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p784-3"></a>[Page 784, Column 3]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; f. Manu's wife (= <em>man&#x0101;vii</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> ; Trigonella Corniculata <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> [Cf. Goth. <em>manna</em> ; Germ. <em>&#x1e43;annus</em>, son of <em>&#x1e6d;uisto</em> <em>&#x1e6d;&#x1e43;</em>, mentioned by Tacitus, in his wk. <em>&#x1e45;ermania</em>, as the mythical ancestor of the West-Germans, <em>mann</em>, <em>man</em> ; Angl. Sax. <em>man</em> ; Eng. <em>man</em>.]</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; manukap&#x0101;la </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;kap&#x0101;la</em> n. Manu's bowl or dish <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kapish&#x1e6d;h">Kapish&#x1e6d;h.</a></dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em> or <em>&#x012b;</em>), f. a woman <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-n&#x0101;tha</em> (cf. Da&#x015b;.), <em>-pati</em> (<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> &amp;c.), m. 'lord of men', a prince, king </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-loka</em> m. 'world of men', the earth <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-"&#x1e63;j&#x00e2;tmaja</em> m. 'son of man', a man' <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. a woman <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-"&#x1e63;j&#x00e2;dhipa</em> and <em>&#x25cb;pati</em> m. 'sovereign of men', a prince, king <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x25cb;j&#x012b;-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em> P. <em>-karoti</em>, to change into a man <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kath&#x0101;s">Kath&#x0101;s.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-"&#x1e63;j&#x00ea;ndra</em> m. 'lord of men, a prince, king <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> (<em>&#x25cb;dra-putra</em>, n. <em>&#x25cb;tr&#x012b;</em> f. a prince, princess <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kath&#x0101;s">Kath&#x0101;s.</a>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x25cb;j&#x00ea;&#x015b;vara</em> m. = <em>-"&#x1e63;j&#x00f3;ndra</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VarB&#x1e5b;S">VarB&#x1e5b;S.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-"&#x1e63;j&#x00f4;ttana</em> m. best of men <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a></dd>

           <dd><em>manu&#x1e63;&#x00ea;ndra</em> w&#x1e5b;. for <em>manuj&#x00ea;ndra</em>, q.v</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; manu&#x1e63;ya </dt>

           <dd><em>m&#x00e1;ntra</em> m. (rarely n </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ifc. f. <em>&#x0101;</em>), 'instrument of thought', speech, sacred text or speech, a prayer or song of praise <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#TS">TS.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a Vedic hymn or sacrificial formula, that portion of the Veda which contains the texts called <em>&#x1e5b;c</em> or <em>yajus</em> or <em>s&#x0101;man</em> (q.v.) as opp. to the Br&#x0101;hmana and Upanishad portion ( <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#IW">IW.</a> 5 &amp;c.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#G&#x1e5b;&#x015a;rS">G&#x1e5b;&#x015a;rS.</a> &amp;c. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p786-1"></a>[Page 786, Column 1]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a sacred formula addressed to any individual deity (e.g. <em>om</em> <em>&#x015b;iv&#x0101;ya</em> <em>nama&#x1e25;</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RTL">RTL.</a> 61 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a mystical verse or magical formula (sometimes personified), incantation, charm, spell (esp. in modern times employed by the &#x015a;&#x0101;ktas to acquire superhuman powers </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the primary Mantras being held to be 70 millions in number and the secondary innumerable <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RTL">RTL.</a> 197-202) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> (i, 147, 4) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x0100;&#x015b;v&#x015a;r">&#x0100;&#x015b;v&#x015a;r.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kath&#x0101;s">Kath&#x0101;s.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Su&#x015b;r">Su&#x015b;r.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cousultation, resolution, counsel, advice, plan, design, secret <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of Vish&#x1e47;u <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Vish&#x1e47;">Vish&#x1e47;.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of &#x015a;iva <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in astrol.) the fifth mansion <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VarYogay">VarYogay.</a></dd>

           <dd><em>&#x25cb;antara</em> n. the period or age of a Manu (it comprises about 71 <em>mah&#x0101;-yugas</em> <em>q.v.</em>, which are held equal to 12, 000 years of the gods or 4, 320, 000 human years or 1/14th of a day of Brahm&#x0101; <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p787-1"></a>[Page 787, Column 1]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; each of these periods is presided over by its own special Manu [see <em>manu</em>, p. 784, col. 2] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; six such Manv-antaras have already elapsed, and the 7th, presided over by Manu Vaivasvata, is now going on ; 7 more are to come, making 14 Manv-antaras, which together make up one day of Brahm&#x0101;) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> (esp. i, 79) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;">Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; shaking about, agitating <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Ragh">Ragh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Uttarar">Uttarar.</a> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; a drink in which other ingredients are mixed by stirring, mixed beverage (usually parched barley-meal stirred round in milk </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; but also applied to a partic. medicinal preparation) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a spoon for stirring <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x0100;&#x015b;vG&#x1e5b;">&#x0100;&#x015b;vG&#x1e5b;.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kau&#x015b;">Kau&#x015b;.</a> </dd>

           <dd><em>mand</em> (cf. &#x221a;2. <em>mad</em>), cl. 1. &#x0100;. (<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Dh&#x0101;tup">Dh&#x0101;tup.</a> ii, 12) <em>m&#x00e1;ndate</em> (Ved. also P. <em>&#x25cb;ti</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pf. <em>mamanda</em>, <em>&#x25cb;dat</em>, <em>amamandu&#x1e25;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>mand&#x00fa;s</em>, <em>&#x25cb;d&#x0101;n&#x00e1;</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>amand&#x012b;t</em>, <em>mandi&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;a</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; inf. <em>mand&#x00e1;dhyai</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a>), to rejoice, be glad or delighted, be drunk or intoxicated (lit. and fig.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VS">VS.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (P.) to gladden, exhilarate, intoxicate, inflame, inspirit <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to sleep (?) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VS">VS.</a> (cf. Mah&#x012b;dh.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to shine, be splendid or beautiful <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Naigh">Naigh.</a> i, 16 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to praise or to go <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Dh&#x0101;tup">Dh&#x0101;tup.</a>: Caus. <em>mand&#x00e1;yati</em> (inf. <em>manday&#x00e1;dhyai</em>), to gladden, exhilarate, intoxicate <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be glad or drunk <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; mandra </dt>
           <dd><em>mandr&#x00e1;</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;&#x0341;</em>)n. pleasant, agreeable, charming, (esp.) sounding or speaking pleasantly         <br>          &amp;c. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VS">VS.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;khG&#x1e5b;">&#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;khG&#x1e5b;.</a> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; a kind of drum <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>

           <dt>mand 2</dt>
           <dd><em>mand</em> or <em>mad</em> (only <em>mam&#x00e1;ttana</em>, <em>mamandhi</em>, <em>&#x00e1;maman</em>), to tarry, stand still, pause <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> (cf. <em>upa-ni-&#x221a;mand</em> and <em>ni-&#x221a;mad</em>): Caus., <em>mandaya</em></dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; manda </dt>
           <dd><em>manda</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;</em>) n. slow, tardy, moving slowly or softly, loitering, idle, lazy, sluggish in (loc. or comp.), apathetic, phlegmatic, indifferent to (dat.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; weak, slight, slack (as a bow), dull, faint (as light), low (as a voice), gentle (as rain or wind), feeble (as the digestive faculty) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; weak i.e. tolerant, indulgent to (loc.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; dull-witted, silly, stupid, foolish <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Ka&#x1e6d;hUp">Ka&#x1e6d;hUp.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; unhappy, miserable (<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> = <em>k&#x1e5b;pa&#x1e47;a</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hariv">Hariv.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; languid, ill, sick <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#M&#x0101;lav">M&#x0101;lav.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; bad, wicked <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#M&#x0101;rkP">M&#x0101;rkP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; drunken, addicted to intoxication <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = <em>-mandra</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. the planet Saturn <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Var">Var.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the (upper) apsis of a planet's course or (according to some) its anomalistic motion <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#S&#x016b;ryas">S&#x016b;ryas.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of Yama <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a stupid or slow elephant <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> (cf. <em>mandra</em>, <em>bhadra-manda</em>, <em>m&#x1e5b;ga-manda</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the end of the world (= <em>pralaya</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. a pot, vessel, inkstand <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of D&#x0101;ksh&#x0101;ya&#x1e47;&#x012b; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Cat">Cat.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (scil. <em>sa&#x1e43;kr&#x0101;nti</em>) a partic. astron. conjunction <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in music) N. of a &#x015a;ruti <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Sa&#x1e43;g&#x012b;t">Sa&#x1e43;g&#x012b;t.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. the second change which takes place in warm milk when mixed with Takra <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), ind. slowly, tardily, gradually, slightly, faintly, softly (also <em>manda</em> ibc., and <em>mandam mandam</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; mandakar&#x1e47;a </dt>

           <dd>&#x2022; N. of the wife of Utathya and mother of D&#x012b;rgha-tamas <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> vi, 10, 2 (cf. S&#x0101;y.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-yukta</em> mfn. filled with selfishness, a miser or egotist (= <em>k&#x1e5b;pa&#x1e47;a</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>

           <dd><em>maru&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;a</em> m. N. of a prince <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Cat">Cat.</a> (also <em>-r&#x0101;ja</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Si&#x1e43;h&#x00e2;s">Si&#x1e43;h&#x00e2;s.</a>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pl. of a dynasty and a people <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VP">VP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. = <em>maru&#x1e6d;&#x0101;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a></dd>

           <dt>marut </dt>
           <dd><em>mar&#x00fa;t</em> m. pl. (prob. the 'flashing or shining ones' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>mar&#x012b;ci</em> and Gk. ?) the storm-gods (Indra's [790, 2] companions and sometimes, e.g. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Ragh">Ragh.</a> xii, 101 = <em>dev&#x0101;&#x1e25;</em>, the gods or deities in general </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; said in the Veda to be the sons of Rudra and P&#x1e5b;i&#x015b;ni, q.v., or the children of heaven or of ocean </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; and described as armed with golden weapons i.e. lightnings and thunderbolts, as having iron teeth and roaring like lions, as residing in the north, as riding in golden cars drawn by ruddy horses sometimes called P&#x1e5b;ishat&#x012b;, q.v </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; they are reckoned in <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Naigh">Naigh.</a> v, 5 among the gods of the middle sphere, and in <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> viii, 96, 8 are held to be three times sixty in number </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in the later literature they are the children of Diti, either seven or seven times seven in number, and are sometimes said to be led by M&#x0101;tari&#x015b;van) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the god of the wind (father of Hanumat and regent of the north-west quarter of the sky) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kir">Kir.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R&#x0101;jat">R&#x0101;jat.</a> (cf. comp.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; wind, air, breath (also applied to the five winds in the body) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pur">Pur.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a species of plant <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Bhpr">Bhpr.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = <em>&#x1e5b;tvij</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Naigh">Naigh.</a> iii, 18 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; gold <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> i, 2 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; beauty <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> iii, 7 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a S&#x0101;dhya <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hariv">Hariv.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of the prince B&#x1e5b;ihad-ratha <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MaitrUp">MaitrUp.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; f. Trigonella Corniculata <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. a kind of fragrant substance (= <em>granthi-par&#x1e47;a</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a></dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; (in med.) any bodily excretion or secretion (esp. those of the Dh&#x0101;tus, q.v., described as phlegm from chyle, bile from the blood, nose mucus and ear wax from the flesh, perspiration from the fat, nails and hair from the bones, rheum of the eye from the brain </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; n. tanned leather, a leathern or dirty garment (?) cf. RV. x, 136, 2 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a kind of brass or bell-metal cf. L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the tip of a scorpion's tail cf. L. (v. l. <em>ala</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; mfn. dirty, niggardly cf. L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; unbelieving, godless cf. L. [Cf. Gk. ? ; [792, 1] Lat. [malus] ; Lith. <em>m&#x00f3;lis</em>, <em>m&#x00e9;lynas</em>.]</dd>

           <dd><em>mah</em> (orig. <em>magh</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. also &#x221a;<em>ma&#x1e43;h</em>), cl. 1. 10. P. (cf. Dh&#x0101;tup. xvii, 81 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; xxxv, 15) <em>mahati</em>, <em>mah&#x00e1;yati</em> (Ved. and ep. also &#x0100;. <em>mahate</em>, <em>&#x25cb;h&#x00e1;yate</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; p. <em>mah&#x00e1;t</em>, q.v </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pf. <em>mam&#x0101;ha</em> Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>m&#x0101;mah&#x00e9;</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Subj. <em>m&#x0101;mahanta</em>, <em>m&#x0101;mahas</em> cf. RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>amah&#x012b;t</em> Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. <em>mahit&#x0101;</em>, <em>mahi&#x1e63;yati</em> cf. ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ind. p. <em>mahitv&#x0101;</em> cf. MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; inf. <em>mahe</em>, and <em>mah&#x00e1;ye</em>, q.v.) to elate, gladden, exalt, arouse, excite cf. RV. cf. Br. cf. Kau&#x015b;. cf. ChUp. cf. MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to magnify, esteem highly, honour, revere cf. MBh. cf. K&#x0101;v. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (&#x0100;.) to rejoice, delight in (instr. or acc.) cf. RV. iii, 52, 6 ; vi, 15, 2 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to give, bestow cf. ib. i, 94, 6 ; 117, 17 ; v, 27, 1 &amp;c. [Cf. Gk. ? ; [794, 1] Lat. <em>magnus</em>, <em>mactus</em> ; Old Germ. <em>michel</em> ; Eng. <em>mickle</em>, <em>much</em>.]</dd>

           <dd><em>&#x25cb;r&#x1e63;i</em> m. a great &#x1e5a;ishi, any great sage or saint (accord. to <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> i, 34 ten Maharshis were created by Manu Sv&#x0101;yambhuva, viz. Mar&#x012b;ci, Atri, A&#x1e45;giras, Pulastya, Pulaha, Kratu, Pracetas, Vasish&#x1e6d;ha, Bh&#x1e5b;igu, N&#x0101;rada, also called the 10 Praj&#x0101;patis, q.v </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; some restrict the number to 7, and some add Daksha, Dharma, Gautama, Ka&#x1e47;va, V&#x0101;lm&#x012b;ki, Vy&#x0101;sa, Manu, Vibh&#x0101;&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;aka &amp;c.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c.            <dd>&#x2022; N. of &#x015a;iva <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;ivag">&#x015a;ivag.</a> </dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; mahacchabda </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;chabda</em> (<em>&#x015b;abda</em>), the word <em>mahat</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kath&#x0101;s">Kath&#x0101;s.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; mahat </dt>
           <dd><em>mah&#x00e1;t</em> mfn. (orig. pr. p. of &#x221a;1. <em>mah</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; strong form, <em>mah&#x0101;nt</em> f. <em>mahat&#x012b;&#x0341;</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in ep. often <em>mahat</em> for <em>mah&#x0101;ntam</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ibc. mostly <em>mah&#x0101;</em>, q.v.) great (in space, time, quantity or degree), i.e. large, big, huge, ample, extensive, long, abundant, numerous, considerable, important, high, eminent <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c. (also ind. in <em>mahad-&#x221a;bh&#x016b;</em>, to become great or full <em>said of the moon</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;i&#x015b;">&#x015a;i&#x015b;.</a>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; abounding on rich in (instr.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ChUp">ChUp.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (ifc.) distinguished by <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;ak">&#x015a;ak.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; early (morning) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; advanced (afternoon) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; violent (pain or emotion) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; thick (as darkness), gross <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; loud (as noise) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L&#x0101;&#x1e6d;y">L&#x0101;&#x1e6d;y.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; many (people, with <em>jana</em> sg.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> (with <em>uktha</em> n. a partic. Uktha of 720 verses </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>aukthya</em> n. N. of a S&#x0101;man <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>mah&#x0101;nti bh&#x016b;t&#x0101;ni</em>, the gross elements <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>mah&#x0101;bh&#x016b;ta</em>) </dd>

  <dd><em></em>                 <br>          <em>mah&#x0101;tripurasundar&#x012b;t&#x0101;pan&#x012b;yopani&#x1e63;ad</em>3<em>mah&#x0101;&#x0341;--tripura-sundar&#x012b;-t&#x0101;pan&#x012b;y&#x00f4;pani&#x1e63;ad</em> and f. N. of two Upanishads</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; mah&#x0101;brahma </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;brahma</em> or m. the great Brahman, the Supreme Spirit <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Buddh">Buddh.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; mah&#x0101;brahman </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;brah&#x1e0d;man</em> m. the great Brahman, the Supreme Spirit <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Buddh">Buddh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pl. (with Buddhists) one of the 18 classes of gods of the world of form <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Dharmas">Dharmas.</a> 128 (cf. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MWB">MWB.</a> 210 &amp;c.)</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; a great Br&#x0101;hman (in ironical sense) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#M&#x1e5b;icch">M&#x1e5b;icch.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Ratn&#x00e2;v">Ratn&#x00e2;v.</a> (= <em>&#x1e47;indita-brahman</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a priest who officiates at a &#x015a;r&#x0101;ddha or solemn ceremony in honour of deceased ancestors <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#W">W.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. 'great Br&#x0101;hma&#x1e47;a', N. of the T&#x0101;&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;ya Br&#x1e6d;Br&#x0101;hma&#x1e47;a </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-bh&#x0101;gya</em> w&#x1e5b;. for <em>br&#x0101;hma&#x1e47;amah&#x0101;-bh&#x25cb;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; mah&#x0101;bh&#x0101;rata </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;bh&#x0101;rata</em> m. or n. (with or scil. <em>&#x0101;hava</em>, <em>yuddha</em> or any word signifying 'battle') the great war of the Bharatas <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hariv">Hariv.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. (cf. IW. 370 &amp;c.) </dd>
